Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of Scott Walker's tax plan on the average Wisconsin taxpayer by stating they only received $11 per month in savings.
Understate: The claim understates the tax cuts received by corporations, stating they received $610 million in tax cuts.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support for the statement that millionaires received at least $1,400 per year in tax cuts.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Scott Walker's tax plan only had one version, when there have been several measures affecting income and property taxes.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores other property tax relief measures approved by Walker and only focuses on reductions in one type of tax.
